info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:42PM MDT until July 08 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL LIBERTY AND WEST CENTRAL HILL COUNTIES... At 641 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles north of Inverness, or 18 miles northeast of Chester, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported 1 to 1.5 inch hail along the Hill and Liberty County line. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Liberty and west central Hill Counties. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
